attributes.action: Stop the postcode lottery in council areas when it comes to burying a baby
attributes.additional_details: Depending on where you are in the country will impact the cost incurred for grave deeds. For example you automatically get grave deed ownership for a baby’s burial at no cost in Liverpool but in Dorset you have to pay £600 to own the grave before you can add a headstone, this is unfair and adds to the distress adding unnecessary financial stress as parents want the opportunity to be able to do something for their baby in their memory
attributes.background: We want the government to either completely scrap fees for grave ownership deeds for any burial of a baby or child from early gestational loss to 18 years old; or have one set price for owning a grave deed all over the U.K. with the ability to have a payment plan

rejection.details:
The fees charged by public burial and cremation authorities are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

The Children’s Funeral Fund for England can help to pay for some of the costs of a funeral, including burial fees, for a child under 18 or a baby stillborn after the 24th week of pregnancy: https://www.gov.uk/child-funeral-costs

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to extend the Children’s Funeral Fund to pay for any costs that are currently covered by this scheme.
